cab.content: WAR OABIM?. y'Gen.No ./6. -Treatment of Prisoners of war.Addendum to the note by the Secretary of State for War/datedSince writing the above I have, received, a letter from Lord Newton in which he says that he does, not think-that the stoppage of parcels to our Prisoners is an act of reprisal. I agree that he is probably right, but I have no definite information on which, to go, no answer having, been received from Sir Walter Townley, -."With regard to the French employment of German Prisoners of War, i have now received-information that the latter have already been withdrawn by -two Army Groups beyond the 30 kilometre line, and other two. -Groups are doing, so.- Derby,
